alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 2:07AM CDT until further notice by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 207 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Fresnos, South Padre Island, Rancho Viejo, Port Of Brownsville, Laureles, Cameron Park, Olmito, Southmost, Downtown Brownsville, La Paloma, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Laguna Vista Police Department, Holly Beach, Los Fresnos High School, Los Fresnos City Offices, Lopez - Riggins Elementary School, Palmer Laasko Elementary, Rivera High School and Rancho Verde Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
